intro: Osteospermum pungens, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers with yellow centers and white or pink petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and thrives in full sun with well-drained soil. Its foliage is lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Osteospermum pungens is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
